content.description: Start by climbing over the rosebush and up into the large pod like groove.  Funky climbing leads to the crux of getting out of the large groove and into the bad handcrack above.  Bring a small nut or run it out.
content.protection: Bolts and 1 small nut.  2 Bolt Anchor

content.description: A good (if somewhat smelly) climb that goes up the small crack system with fun patina holds on either side.  Protects well until the very top where the crack ends.  Watch out for the large amount of dung about 2/3rds up.
content.protection: A rack of singles from 1-3 Camalots with doubles from .3-.75 will let you sew this bad boy up.  Fixed 2 Bolt anchor with Chains
content.location: Ascends up the crack that recently some dipshit lit a fire in the back of until it terminates and then heads up to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Start above the rose bush and follow the 4 bolts up a face.  A small nut placement is available up top to protect between the 3rd and 4th bolt.  Kind of funky climbing.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a optional small nut leads to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Just to the left of a large groove system this climb goes up past 4 bolts.

content.description: A single bolt protects this face climb, unless you decide to place gear and climb the crack to the right instead. Nothing special, but an okay place (at Revenue Flats) for a first time climber to try top roping.
content.protection: A single bolt for the lead and a single bolt for an anchor.
content.location: When looking at the main climbing area of The Nuggets, look to the formation to the left with the tree on top.

content.description: Climb up in between two crack systems on face holds.  Has a couple of hero jugs that make it a fun climb.  Joins with the top of Sxe Phil to get to the anchors.
Climb up the challenging face using smalls nubbins and rails for holds.  Has a couple of hero jugs that make it feel very doable.  One of the best on this wall IMO.
content.location: Down the small alleyway between two large boulders this climb is on the right side of a large open book capped by a small roof.  Begins above a very annoying tree.

content.description: Head up the face clipping three bolts in the process.  Don't blow the first couple moves or you and your belayer would get scraped down the rocks.
content.protection: 3 bolts to build your own trad anchor.
content.location: When walking down the small alleyway toward Greeno's Oil can this route is the one located on the almost arete like feature to the left.  Starts up on top of a small ramp.

content.description: A somewhat funky start leads to a high first bolt.  Follow through this for 2 more bolts until you reach the top.  Either set up a belay in the back (Gear Required) or head to the bolts to the right (Terrible rope drag).  Scramble off the backside by walking to your left when you summit and down a large runnel.
content.location: To the left of the large open book with crack in back this climb starts above a sloping ledge.  Don't fall going for the first or its going to be ugly.

content.description: A fun climb that sadly suffers from a rather poor bolting job for the anchor, Evolution Dance climbs the prow just to the right of the large burned out crack system.  Head up the face pulling through a small bulge and continuing until you reach a set of anchors on your right for Achmed the Dead Terrorist.  Either set up a top rope here or continue on to the Smoosh anchor set.  Neither is ideal, so this route is really best to be lead and then cleaned in one go.
content.protection: 3 Bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Right of the large burned out chimney system.

content.description: Head up into a large groove like formation and head to the crack in the back.  A little run out to the first gear placement but really easy.  Continue through hero jugs up the groove and then it ramps down.  Use either the left or right side anchors.
content.protection: Some small TCU's and #.5-3.  A number 4 is handy if you wish to protect the upper section.  Kind of hard to select a rack for due to the spastic crack sizes.
content.location: This route is below a large grove that starts about 6 feet up and about equidistant between the end of the formation and the large boulder.

content.description: Climb up the large crack system stemming as you go up.  More fun than it looks!  Clip the bolts to the right of you as you climb and finish on the same anchors as Hot for Words and Sxe Phil.

A bolted line that starts under the large under hanging feature about 4 feet above the ground this line goes up and through this and then onto easier ground.  Some knucklehead started a fire under this undercling, covering it with soot and grime and therefore making it a bit more challenging than it used to be.
content.protection: Bolts to a 3 bolt funky anchor.  Bring slings to set as a top rope.
content.location: At the end of the formation, this climb starts under a large overhanging formation around 4 feet off the ground.
